properties.name: Amount
properties.description: When the method is fixed amount, this is the periodic depreciation amount

properties.name: MaxPercentage
properties.description: Indicates the maximum value when using depreciation type degressive to linear

properties.name: Percentage
properties.description: Degressive percentage for methods: 10 - Degressive to linear, 11 - Degressive (fixed perc. of book value), 12 - Degressive to linear (Belgium & Luxembourg only). And interest percentage for method: 40 - Normal annuity method. On import: Can not be modified if depreciation method is already linked to an asset. For Belgium & Luxembourg the degressive percentage is calculated as double of the linear percentage

properties.name: Percentage2
properties.description: Linear percentage for methods: 10 - Degressive to linear, 3 - Linear depreciation (Belgium & Luxembourg only), 12 - Degressive to linear (Belgium & Luxembourg only). On import: Can not be modified if depreciation method is already linked to an asset

properties.name: Periods
properties.description: The total number of periods for the depreciation method. Used in combination with depreciation interval: only used when interval is periodic

properties.name: Type
properties.description: The actual type of deprecation, such as lineair or degressive. The periodic amounts are based on this type, in combination with other fields, such as the interval and the periods

properties.name: Years
properties.description: Determines the total number of years for the depreciation method. Used in combination with depreciation interval: only used when interval is yearly

properties.description: When processing payments, all payments with the same processing data are put in a batch. This field contains the code of that batch.

properties.description: The currency of the payment. This currency can only deviate from the division currency if the module Currency is in the license.

properties.description: Extra description for the payment that may be included in the bank export file.

properties.description: Date before which the payment must be done to be eligible for discount.

properties.description: Document that is created when processing payments. The bank export file is attached to the document.

properties.description: Date before which the payment must be done.

properties.description: Date since when the payment is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest invoice date of all matched payments.

properties.description: Period since when the payment is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest period of all matched payments.

properties.name: EndYear
properties.description: Year (of period) since when the payment is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest year of all matched payments. Used in combination with EndPeriod.

properties.description: The unique identifier for a set of payments. A payment can be split so that one part is paid on a different date. In that case the two records get a different EntryID.

properties.description: Payment condition of the linked transaction.

properties.description: Number of days between invoice date and due date of the discount.

properties.description: Discount given on the default price. Discount = (DefaultPrice of Item - PriceItem in line) / DefaultPrice of Item

properties.name: DiscountType
properties.description: Leading field of total discount. 1=Discount percentage, 2=Discount amount excl. VAT, 3=Discount amount incl. VAT, 4=Total amount excl. VAT, 5=Total amount incl. VAT

properties.name: Document
properties.description: Document that is manually linked to the invoice

properties.name: DueDate
properties.description: The due date for payments. This date is calculated based on the EntryDate and the Paymentcondition

properties.name: Employee
properties.description: Link to Employee originating from time and cost transactions

properties.name: EndTime
properties.description: EndTime is used to store the last date of a period. EndTime is used in combination with StartTime

properties.name: ExtraDutyAmountFC
properties.description: Extra duty amount in the currency of the transaction. Both extra duty amount and VAT amount need to be specified in order to differ this property from automatically calculated.

properties.name: GAccountAmountFC
properties.description: A positive value of the amount indicates that the amount is to be paid by the customer to your G bank account.In case of a credit invoice the amount should have negative value when retrieved or posted to Exact.

properties.name: GLAccount
properties.description: The GL Account of the sales invoice line. This field is mandatory. This field is generated based on the revenue account of the item (or the related item group). G/L Account is also used to determine whether the costcenter / costunit is mandatory

properties.name: InvoiceDate
properties.description: Official date for the invoice. When the invoice is entered it's equal to the field 'EntryDate'. During the printing process the invoice date can be entered

properties.name: InvoiceID
properties.description: The InvoiceID identifies the sales invoice. All the lines of a sales invoice have the same InvoiceID

properties.name: InvoiceNumber
properties.description: Assigned at entry or at printing depending on setting. The number assigned is based on the freenumbers as defined for the Journal. When printing the field InvoiceNumber is copied to the fields EntryNumber and InvoiceNumber of the sales entry

properties.name: InvoiceTo
properties.description: Reference to the Customer who will receive the invoice

properties.name: InvoiceToContactPerson
properties.description: Reference to the Contact person of the customer who will receive the invoice

properties.name: InvoiceToContactPersonFullName

properties.name: InvoiceToName
properties.description: Name of the customer who will receive the invoice

properties.name: IsExtraDuty
properties.description: Indicates whether the invoice has extra duty

properties.name: Item
properties.description: Reference to the item that is sold in this sales invoice line

properties.name: Journal
properties.description: The journal code. Every invoice should be linked to a sales journal

properties.name: LineNumber
properties.description: Indicates the sequence of the lines within one invoice

properties.name: NetPrice
properties.description: Net price of the sales invoice line

properties.name: OrderedByContactPersonFullName

properties.name: OrderedByName
properties.description: Name of customer who ordered the invoice

properties.name: OrderNumber
properties.description: Number to identify the order. By default the number is based on a setting for the first free number, but you can post your own number.

properties.name: PaymentCondition
properties.description: The payment condition used for due date and discount calculation

properties.name: Project
properties.description: The project to which the sales transaction line is linked. The project can be different per line. Sometimes also the project in the header is filled although this is not really used

properties.name: ProjectWBS
properties.description: WBS linked to the sales invoice

properties.name: Quantity
properties.description: The number of items sold in default units. The quantity shown in the entry screen is Quantity * UnitFactor

properties.name: SalesOrder

properties.name: SalesOrderLine

properties.description: Then line number of the sales order line on which this invoice line is based on

properties.name: SalesOrderNumber

properties.name: StarterSalesInvoiceStatus
properties.description: Starter Sales invoice status (for starter functionality)

properties.name: StartTime
properties.description: StartTime is used to store the first date of a period. StartTime is used in combination with EndTime

properties.name: Status
properties.description: The status of the entry. 10 = draft. During the creation of an invoice draft records occur in the draft modus if during an invoice a new page with lines is triggered. If the user leaves the invoice in an abnormal way the draft invoices can be recovered. Draft invoices are not included in financial reports, balances etc. 20 = open. Open invoices can be changed. New invoices get the status open by default. 50 = processed. Processed invoices can't be changed anymore. Processing is done via printing. Processed invoices can't be reopened

properties.name: Subscription
properties.description: When generating invoices from subscriptions, this field records the link between invoice lines and subscription lines

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Indicates the type of invoice Values: 8020 - Sales invoices, 8021 - Sales credit note, 8023 - Direct sales invoice, 8024 - Direct credit note. Type 8023 and 8024 are only supported by the Advanced and Premium editions for Wholesale & Distribution and Manufacturing

properties.description: Date that the mandate is signed. The collection must take place after the signature date of the mandate. The date is used to check the validity of the mandate.

properties.description: Number of days to pay within, to have the right to take the discount

properties.name: PaymentDays
properties.description: Number of days to be included in the due date calculation. Example: invoice date = 17/01 PaymentEndOfMonths = 2 => 31/03 PaymentDays = 15 => 15/04

properties.name: PaymentDiscountType

properties.name: PaymentMethod
properties.description: Method of payment. Values: B = On credit, I = Collection, K = Cash

properties.name: Percentage

properties.description: Own bank account number from which the payment must be done.

properties.description: When processing payments, all payments with the same processing data are put in a batch. This field contains the code of that batch.

properties.description: The currency of the payment. This currency can only deviate from the division currency if the module Currency is in the license.

properties.description: Date before which the payment must be done to be eligible for discount.

properties.description: Document that is created when processing payments. The bank export file is attached to the document.

properties.description: Date before which the payment must be done.

properties.name: EndDate
properties.description: Date since when the payment is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest invoice date of all matched payments.

properties.name: EndPeriod
properties.description: Period since when the payment is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest period of all matched payments.

properties.name: EndYear
properties.description: Year (of period) since when the payment is no longer an outstanding item. This is the highest year of all matched payments. Used in combination with EndPeriod.

properties.name: EntryID
properties.description: The unique identifier for a set of payments. A payment can be split so that one part is paid on a different date. In that case the two records get a different EntryID.

properties.name: EntryNumber
properties.description: Entry number of the linked transaction.

properties.name: GLAccount
properties.description: G/L account of the payment. Must be of type 22 (Accounts payable).

properties.name: InvoiceDate
properties.description: Invoice date of the linked transaction.

properties.name: InvoiceNumber
properties.description: Invoice number of the linked transaction.

properties.name: IsBatchBooking
properties.description: Boolean indicating whether the payment is part of a batch booking.

properties.name: PaymentBatchNumber
properties.description: Number assigned during the of processing payments. When payments are processed a bank export file is created. This file contains one or more batches that contain one or more payments. Each batch gets a sequence number that is stored for each payment in that batch.

properties.name: PaymentCondition
properties.description: Payment condition of the linked transaction.

properties.name: PaymentDays
properties.description: Number of days between invoice date and due date.

properties.name: PaymentDaysDiscount
properties.description: Number of days between invoice date and due date of the discount.

properties.name: PaymentMethod
properties.description: Method of payment. B = On credit (default) I = Collection K = Cash V = Credit card.

properties.name: PaymentReference
properties.description: Payment reference for the payment that may be included in the bank export file.

properties.name: PaymentSelected
properties.description: Date and time since when the payment is selected to be paid.

properties.name: PaymentSelector
properties.description: User who selected the payment to be paid.

properties.name: RateFC
properties.description: Exchange rate from payment currency to division currency. AmountFC * RateFC = AmountDC.

properties.name: Status
properties.description: The status of the payment. 20 = open 30 = selected - payment is selected to be paid 40 = processed - payment has been done 50 = matched - payment is matched with one or more other outstanding items or financial statement lines

properties.name: TransactionAmountDC
properties.description: Total amount of the linked transaction in default currency (division currency).

properties.name: TransactionAmountFC
properties.description: Total amount of the linked transaction in the selected currency.

properties.description: Indicates if the linked transaction is a reversal entry.

properties.name: IsStockItem
properties.description: If you have the Trade or Manufacturing license and you check this property the item will be shown in the stock positions overview, stock counts and transaction lists. If you have the Invoice module and you check this property you will get a general journal entry based on the Stock and Costs G/L accounts of the item group. If you don’t want the general journal entry to be created you should change the Stock/Costs G/L account on the Item group page to the type Costs instead of Inventory.

properties.description: The number of lines of the returned mail message attachment (Kirean scan service).

properties.description: Reference to the account that is receiving this mail message.

properties.description: Indicates whether the recipient deleted this message. If this is the case the recipient can't see it anymore and the sender can actually delete it.

properties.name: RecipientMailbox
properties.description: The mailbox address of the recipient.

properties.name: RecipientMailboxDescription
properties.description: The description of the mailbox of the recipient.

properties.name: RecipientMailboxID
properties.description: The mailbox ID of the recipient. The owner of this mailbox will see the message in the inbox.

properties.name: RecipientStatus
properties.description: The status of the mail message, only the recipient can update this. RecipientStatus can have the following values: 5= Rejected42= In process10= Draft43= At the scanning service20= Open45= Error during processing25= Prepared46= Blocked30= Approved50= Processed40= Realized

properties.name: RecipientStatusDescription
properties.description: The description of the recipient status in English.

properties.name: SenderAccount
properties.description: Reference to the account of the sender.

properties.name: SenderDateSent
properties.description: Date the message was sent. By default this is the date the message is created. It can be an earlier date when the mail message is imported from xml (the date the xml was sent).

properties.name: SenderDeleted
properties.description: Indicates whether the sender deleted the message. This means the sender can't see it anymore and the recipient can actually delete it.

properties.name: SenderIPAddress
properties.description: The IP address of the sender.

properties.name: SenderMailbox
properties.description: The mailbox address of the sender. The owner of this mailbox will see the message in the sent items.

properties.name: SenderMailboxDescription
properties.description: The description of the sender mailbox.

properties.name: SenderMailboxID
properties.description: The mailbox ID of the sender. The owner of this mailbox will see the message in the sent items.

properties.name: Subject
properties.description: The subject of the mail message.

properties.name: SynchronizationCode
properties.description: Provides a link between Exact Online and the banks.

properties.name: ID
properties.description: A guid that uniquely identifies the purchase invoice line.

properties.name: Amount
properties.description: In a GET request the line amount is always returned excluding VAT.In a POST request the line amount has to be submitted either including or excluding the VAT amount. This depends on the type (including or excluding) of the VAT code.

properties.name: CostCenter
properties.description: The code of the cost center that is linked to this invoice line.

properties.name: CostUnit
properties.description: The code of the cost unit that is linked to this invoice line.

properties.name: Currency
properties.description: The currency of the line amount. The total invoice amount and all individual line amounts are in the same currency.

properties.name: Discount
properties.description: The discount given on the default price. A value of 0.1 translates to 10% discount.

properties.name: Expense
properties.description: Expense related to the Work Breakdown Structure of the selected project. Only available with a professional service license

properties.name: ExpenseDescription
properties.description: Description of expense. Only available with a professional service license

properties.name: InvoiceID
properties.description: The unique identifier of the purchase invoice this line belongs to.

properties.name: Item
properties.description: Guid that identifies the purchase item. In a POST request either the Item or the PurchaseOrderLine has to be supplied.

properties.name: ItemUnit
properties.description: The default unit of the purchased item.

properties.name: LineNumber
properties.description: The sequence number of the line.

properties.name: Modified
properties.description: The date and time the invoice line was last modified.

properties.name: NetPrice
properties.description: The net price that has to be paid per unit. NetPrice = UnitPrice * (1.0 - Discount).Depending on the type of the VAT code the net price is including or excluding VAT.

properties.name: Notes
properties.description: The user can enter notes related to the invoice line here.

properties.name: Project
properties.description: The project linked to the purchase invoice line. This field is only applicable for Manufacturing and Professional Services.

properties.name: PurchaseOrderLine
properties.description: Guid that identifies the purchase order line that is being invoiced. When doing a POST either the Item or the PurchaseOrderLine has to be supplied.The values of the purchase order line such as Quantity, Item and Amount will be copied to the purchase invoice line.

properties.name: Quantity
properties.description: The number of purchased items in purchase units. The purchase unit is defined on the item card and it can also be found using the logistics/SupplierItem api endpoint.For divisible items the quantity can be a fractional number, otherwise it is an integer.

properties.name: QuantityInDefaultUnits
properties.description: The number of purchased items in default units. An item has both a default unit and a purchase unit, for example piece and box with a box containing 12 pieces. The multiplication factor (12 in this example) between the default unit and purchase unit is maintained on the item card. When you GET a purchase invoice line for 1 box of items the field Quantity = 1 and QuantityInDefaultUnits = 12.

properties.name: Rebill
properties.description: Indicates whether the purchase invoice line needs to be rebilled. Only available with a professional service license

properties.name: Unit
properties.description: The code of the unit in which the item is purchased. For example piece, box or kg. The value is taken from the purchase unit in the item card.

properties.name: UnitPrice
properties.description: The default purchase price per unit.Depending on the type of the VAT code the unit price is including or excluding VAT.

properties.name: VATAmount
properties.description: The VAT amount of the invoice line.

properties.name: VATCode
properties.description: The VAT code used for the invoice line.

properties.name: ID
properties.description: A guid that is the unique identifier of the purchase invoice.

properties.name: Amount
properties.description: The amount including VAT in the currency of the invoice.

properties.name: ContactPerson
properties.description: Guid identifying the contact person of the supplier.

properties.name: Currency
properties.description: The code of the currency of the invoiced amount.

properties.name: Document
properties.description: Guid identifying a document that is attached to the invoice.

properties.name: DueDate
properties.description: The date before which the invoice has to be paid. This by default will be set according to the payment condition.

properties.name: EntryNumber
properties.description: The unique number of the purchase invoice. The entry number is based on a setting in the purchase journal and incremented for each new purchase invoice.

properties.name: ExchangeRate
properties.description: The exchange rate between the invoice currency and the default currency of the division.

properties.name: FinancialPeriod
properties.description: The financial period in which the invoice is entered.

properties.name: FinancialYear
properties.description: The financial year in which the invoice is entered.

properties.name: InvoiceDate
properties.description: The date on which the supplier entered the invoice.

properties.name: Journal
properties.description: The code of the purchase journal in which the invoice is entered.

properties.name: Modified
properties.description: The date and time the invoice was last modified.

properties.name: PaymentCondition
properties.description: The code of the payment condition that is used to calculate the due date and discount.

properties.name: PaymentReference
properties.description: Unique reference to match payments and invoices.

properties.name: PurchaseInvoiceLines
properties.description: The collection of lines that belong to the purchase invoice.

properties.name: Remarks
properties.description: The user can enter remarks related to the invoice here.

properties.name: Source
properties.description: Indicates the origin of the invoice. 1 Manual entry, 3 Purchase invoice, 4 Purchase order, 5 Web service.

properties.name: Status
properties.description: The status of the invoice. 10 Draft, 20 Open, 50 Processed.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Indicates the type of the purchase invoice. 8030 Direct purchase invoice, 8031 Direct purchase invoice (Credit), 8033 Purchase invoice, 8034 Purchase invoice (Credit)

properties.name: VATAmount
properties.description: The total VAT amount of the purchase invoice.

properties.name: Warehouse
properties.description: Guid that identifies the warehouse that will receive the purchased goods. This is mandatory for creating a direct purchase invoice.

properties.name: YourRef
properties.description: The invoice number provided by the supplier.

properties.name: AmountDC
properties.description: Amount in the default currency of the company

properties.name: AmountFC
properties.description: Amount in the currency of the transaction

properties.name: BatchNumber
properties.description: The number of the batch of entries. Normally a batch consists of multiple entries. Batchnumbers are filled for invoices created by: - Fixed entries - Prolongation (only available with module hosting)

properties.name: DueDate
properties.description: Date when payment should be done

properties.name: GAccountAmountFC
properties.description: A positive value of the amount indicates that the amount is to be paid to the suppliers G bank account.In case of a credit invoice the amount should have negative value when retrieved or posted to Exact.

properties.name: PaymentReference
properties.description: The payment reference used for bank imports, VAT return and Tax reference

properties.name: ProcessNumber
properties.description: Internal processing number, only relevant for Germany

properties.name: ReportingPeriod
properties.description: The period of the transaction lines. The period should exist in the period date table

properties.name: ReportingYear
properties.description: The financial year to which the entry belongs. The financial year should exist in the period date table

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Type: 30 = Purchase entry, 31 = Purchase credit note

properties.name: VATAmountDC
properties.description: Vat Amount in the default currency of the company

properties.name: VATAmountFC
properties.description: Vat Amount in the currency of the transaction

properties.name: AmountDC
properties.description: Amount in the default currency of the company

properties.name: AmountFC
properties.description: Amount in the currency of the transaction

properties.name: EntryID
properties.description: Reference to header of the purchase entry

properties.name: From
properties.description: From date to identify the range for deferred costs. This is used in combination with the property 'To' that defines the end date

properties.name: IntraStatArea
properties.description: IntraStat area (only relevant when IntraStat for purchase is enabled in the administration)

properties.name: IntraStatCountry
properties.description: IntraStatCountry (only relevant when IntraStat for purchase is enabled in the administration)

properties.name: IntraStatDeliveryTerm
properties.description: IntraStat delivery term (only relevant when IntraStat for purchase is enabled in the administration)

properties.name: IntraStatTransactionA
properties.description: IntraStat transaction A (only relevant when IntraStat for purchase is enabled in the administration)

properties.name: IntraStatTransactionB
properties.description: IntraStat transaction B (only relevant when IntraStat for purchase is enabled in the Belgium, Luxembourg, France & United Kingdom administration)

properties.name: IntraStatTransportMethod
properties.description: IntraStat transport method (only relevant when IntraStat for purchase is enabled in the administration)

properties.name: PrivateUsePercentage
properties.description: Percentage of re-invoice part of a cost to the owner of the company.

properties.name: StatisticalNetWeight
properties.description: Statistical NetWeight (only relevant when IntraStat for purchase is enabled in the administration)

properties.name: StatisticalNumber
properties.description: Statistical Number (only relevant when IntraStat for purchase is enabled in the administration)

properties.name: StatisticalQuantity
properties.description: Statistical Quantity (only relevant when IntraStat for purchase is enabled in the administration)

properties.name: StatisticalValue
properties.description: Statistical Value (only relevant when IntraStat for purchase is enabled in the administration)

properties.name: To
properties.description: To date to identify the range for deferred costs. This is used in combination with the property 'From' that defines the start date

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Type: 30 = Purchase entry, 31 = Purchase credit note

properties.name: VATAmountDC
properties.description: VAT amount in the default currency of the company

properties.name: VATAmountFC
properties.description: VAT amount in the currency of the transaction. Use this property to specify a VAT amount that differs from the VAT amount that is automatically calculated.

properties.name: VATBaseAmountDC
properties.description: VAT base amount in the default currency of the company

properties.name: VATBaseAmountFC
properties.description: VAT base amount in the currency of the transaction

properties.name: VATCode
properties.description: VAT code. If this property is not filled, it will use the default VAT code of the G/L account property

properties.name: VATNonDeductiblePercentage
properties.description: If not the full amount of the VAT is deductible, you can indicate a percentage for the non decuctible part. This is used during the entry of purchase invoices.

properties.name: WithholdingAmountDC
properties.description: Withholding tax amount for spanish legislation

properties.name: WithholdingTax
properties.description: Withholding tax key for spanish legislation

properties.description: Indicates if fractional quantities of the item can be used, for example quantity = 0.4

properties.name: NetPrice

properties.name: Project

properties.description: Project code. Only available with a professional service license

properties.name: ProjectDescription
properties.description: Description of the project. Only available with a professional service license

properties.name: ProjectedStock

properties.name: PurchaseOrderID

properties.name: QuantityInPurchaseUnits
properties.description: Quantity in purchase units. Use this field when creating a purchase order

properties.name: ReceiptDate

properties.name: SalesOrder

properties.name: SalesOrderLine

properties.description: Number of the sales order line. Show NULL if more than one sales order is linked to the purchase order line.

properties.name: Current
properties.description: True when this division is most recently used by the API

properties.name: CustomerCode
properties.description: Owner account code of the division

properties.name: CustomerName
properties.description: Owner account name of the division

properties.name: DivisionMoveDate
properties.description: Date when the division was moved. Please resync all data when this value changes because value of Timestamp is regenerated.

properties.name: Hid
properties.description: Company number that is assigned by the customer

properties.name: IsDossierDivision
properties.description: True if the division is a dossier division

properties.name: IsMainDivision
properties.description: True if the division is the main division

properties.name: IsPracticeDivision
properties.description: True if the division is a practice division

properties.name: OBNumber
properties.description: The soletrader VAT number used for offical returns to tax authority

properties.name: ShareCapital
properties.description: the part of the capital of a company that comes from the issue of shares (France)

properties.name: SiretNumber
properties.description: An INSEE code which allows the geographic identification of the company. (France)

properties.name: StartDate
properties.description: Date on which the division becomes active

properties.name: Status
properties.description: Follow the Division Status 0 for Inactive, 1 for Active and 2 for Archived Divisions

properties.name: TaxOfficeNumber
properties.description: Number of your local tax authority (Germany)

properties.name: VATNumber
properties.description: The number under which the account is known at the Value Added Tax collection agency

properties.name: Website
properties.description: Customer value, hyperlink to external website

properties.name: CurrentDivision
properties.description: Division number that is currently used in the API. You should use a division number in the url

properties.name: CustomerCode
properties.description: Account code of the logged in user.

properties.name: DivisionCustomerCode
properties.description: Owner account code of the division

properties.name: DivisionCustomerName
properties.description: Owner account name of the division

properties.name: DivisionCustomerSiretNumber
properties.description: Owner account SIRET Number of the division for French legislation

properties.name: DivisionCustomerVatNumber
properties.description: Owner account VAT Number of the division

properties.name: IsClientUser
properties.description: Client user of an accountant: either a portal user or a non-accountant user with his own license (internal use)

properties.name: IsMyFirmPortalUser
properties.description: MyFirm user of accountant with limited access and specific start page (internal use)

properties.name: LanguageCode
properties.description: Language (culture) that is used in Exact Online

properties.name: PictureUrl
properties.description: Url that can be used to retrieve the picture of the user

properties.name: ServerTime
properties.description: The current date and time in Exact Online

properties.name: ServerUtcOffset
properties.description: The time difference with UTC in seconds

properties.name: ThumbnailPicture
properties.description: Binary thumbnail picture of this user (This property will never return value and will be removed in the near future.)

properties.name: ThumbnailPictureFormat
properties.description: File type of the picture (This property will never return value and will be removed in the near future.)

properties.name: EndDate
properties.description: Indicates the date and time when te role becomes inactive for the user

properties.name: Modifier
properties.description: User ID of the last modifier

properties.name: Role
properties.description: The role that the user is linked to

properties.name: RoleLevel
properties.description: Rolelevel sets the level on which a role for a user is active. This can be: 1 = Database, 2 = Customer, 3 = Division, 100 = Transferred to accountant

properties.name: StartDate
properties.description: Indicates the date when the role becomes active for the user

properties.name: UserID
properties.description: The user that is linked to the role

properties.name: EndDate
properties.description: Indicates the date and time when te role becomes inactive for the user

properties.name: Modifier
properties.description: User ID of the last modifier

properties.name: Role
properties.description: The role that the user is linked to

properties.name: RoleLevel
properties.description: Rolelevel sets the level on which a role for a user is active. This can be: 1 = Database, 2 = Customer, 3 = Division, 100 = Transferred to accountant

properties.name: StartDate
properties.description: Indicates the date when the role becomes active for the user

properties.name: UserID
properties.description: The user that is linked to the role

properties.name: CalculationBasis
properties.description: Indicates how to calculate the tax. 0 = based on the gross amount, 1 = based on the gross amount + another tax

properties.name: Charged
properties.description: Indicates if transactions using the VAT code are transactions of the domestic VAT charging regulation (such as those for subcontractors) or transactions that are registered within the EU. If Charged=1 and linked to a purchase invoice, both a line for the VAT to pay and a line for the VAT to claim are being created

properties.name: EUSalesListing
properties.description: Used in all legislations except France. Indicates if and how transactions using the VAT code appear on the ICT return (EU sales list). L = Listing goods, N = No listing, S = Listing services, T = Triangulation

properties.name: ExcludeVATListing
properties.description: ExcludeVATListing. Used in Belgium Legislation to indicate whether the entries need to be excluded from the VAT Listing.

properties.name: GLDiscountPurchase
properties.description: Indicates the purchase discount GL account linked to the VAT codes for German legislation

properties.name: GLDiscountPurchaseCode
properties.description: Code of the G/L account used for VAT corrections of settlement discount purchase (Germany only)

properties.name: GLDiscountPurchaseDescription
properties.description: Description of the G/L account used for VAT corrections of settlement discount purchase (Germany only)

properties.name: GLDiscountSales
properties.description: Indicates the sales discount GL account linked to the VAT codes for German legislation

properties.name: GLDiscountSalesCode
properties.description: Code of the G/L account used for VAT corrections of settlement discount sales (Germany only)

properties.name: GLDiscountSalesDescription
properties.description: Description of the G/L account used for VAT corrections of settlement discount sales (Germany only)

properties.name: GLToClaim
properties.description: G/L account that is used to book the VAT to claim. If you enter purchases with a VAT code, the VAT amount to be claimed is entered to this VAT account. Must be of type VAT

properties.name: GLToClaimCode
properties.description: Code of the VAT to claim G/L account for the VAT code

properties.name: GLToClaimDescription
properties.description: Description of the VAT to claim G/L account for the VAT code

properties.name: GLToPay
properties.description: G/L account that is used to book the VAT to pay. If you enter sales with a VAT code, the VAT amount to be paid is entered to this VAT account. Must be of type VAT

properties.name: GLToPayCode
properties.description: Code of the VAT to pay G/L account for the VAT code

properties.name: GLToPayDescription
properties.description: Description of the VAT to pay G/L account for the VAT code

properties.name: IntraStat
properties.description: Used in all legislations except France. Indicates if intrastat is used

properties.name: IntrastatType
properties.description: Used in France legislation only. Indicates if and how transactions using the VAT code appear on the DEB/DES return. L = Goods, N = Empty, S = Services

properties.name: IsBlocked
properties.description: Indicates if the VAT code may still be used

properties.name: LegalText
properties.description: Legal description for VAT code to print in the total block of the invoice

properties.name: OssCountry
properties.description: OSS country. Available when OneStopShop featureset is enabled in the administration.

properties.name: TaxReturnType
properties.description: Indicates what type of Taxcode it is: can be VAT, IncomeTax

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Indicates how the VAT amount should be calculated in relation to the invoice amount. B = VAT 0% (Only base amount), E = Excluding, I = Including, N = No VAT

properties.name: VatDocType
properties.description: Field in VAT code maintenance to calculate different VATs depending on the selected document type. P = purchase invoice, F = freelance invoice, E = expense voucher. The field is valid for witholding tax type

properties.name: VatMargin
properties.description: The VAT margin scheme is used for the trade of secondhand goods which are purchased without VAT (for example when a company buys a secondhand good from a private person). In the VAT margin scheme, the VAT is not calculated based on the sales price. Instead of that, the VAT is calculated based on the margin (gross sales price minus the gross purchase price)

properties.name: VATPartialRatio
properties.description: Partial ratio explains which part of the VAT the company has to pay. Used in some branches where the sellers have a bad reputation, so the buyers have to take over the VAT-liability

properties.name: VATPercentages
properties.description: VAT percentages. You can have several VAT percentages, with start and end dates

properties.name: VATTransactionType
properties.description: Indicates the type of transactions for which the VAT code may be used. B = Both, P = Purchase, S = Sales

properties.name: EndDate
properties.description: End date of the date range during which this percentage is valid

properties.name: StartDate
properties.description: Start date of the date range during which this percentage is valid

properties.name: Topic
properties.description: Webhook subscription topic, e.g.: FinancialTransactions, Items, StockPositions

properties.name: DownloadUrl
properties.description: To get the file in its original format (xml, jpg, pdf, etc.) append &Download=1 to the url.

properties.name: Request
properties.description: The request this attachment is linked to

properties.name: AuthenticationType
properties.description: Authentication Type: 2=Forms, 8=Totp, 16=Auth0FederatedSSO, 32=Auth0Login, 64=B2CFederatedLogin, 128=B2CLogin. It is a bitwise enumerator, e.g. Forms + Totp = 10

properties.name: EndDate
properties.description: Date after which the user login is disabled. NULL means no enddate

properties.name: HasRegisteredForTwoStepVerification
properties.description: User has completed registration of Two-Step verification

properties.name: HasTwoStepVerification
properties.description: User must use Two-Step verification to log in

properties.name: IsAnonymised
properties.description: Indicates whether the user is anonymised.

properties.name: IsAPICall
properties.description: To validate default values for API

properties.name: Language
properties.description: Language (culture) that is used in Exact Online

properties.name: LastLogin
properties.description: The last time this user logged in

properties.name: Modifier
properties.description: User ID of the last modifier

properties.name: StartDate
properties.description: Startdate after which the login is allowed. If the start date is NULL the login is allowed as well

SalesChannels.scope: Crm quotes sales orders sales invoices

properties.name: BatchNumbers
properties.description: The collection of batch numbers that belong to the items included in this pick order

properties.name: EntryID
properties.description: The EntryID identifies the digital order picking. All the lines of a digital order picking have the same EntryID

properties.name: IsAssembledItem
properties.description: Indicates that an Item is an assembled item

properties.name: IsBatchNumberItem
properties.description: Indicates that an Item is an batch item

properties.name: IsSerialNumberItem
properties.description: Indicates that an Item is an serial item

properties.name: RelatedID
properties.description: Related digital order picking line ID, for example assembled item picking line ID

properties.name: SerialNumbers
properties.description: The collection of serial numbers that belong to the items included in this pick order

properties.name: StorageLocationDescription
properties.description: Description of item default storage location
